author: lightclient
content: does anyone know a nice tool that i can run and get reports of how my internet looks over a period of time? i have a suspicion my network is being throttled / going down over night

author: sky.cactus
content: A while back I setup a tiny little server hardwired to my modem that just had Grafana, InfluxDB, and a tiny little tool that just pinged a bunch of well known endpoints (1.1.1.1, 1.0.0.1, google.com, local ISP IP, etc.) every second and reporting the timing to Influx.

author: sky.cactus
content: Then I could just look at a chart on Grafana and outages showed up plain as day.

author: sky.cactus
content: It was *kinda* custom, but I didn't have to write any software IIRC.

author: sky.cactus
content: It was just a docker compose file with everything I think.

author: sky.cactus
content: If this interests you I can try to dig up the docker-compose file.  I still have the machine somewhere, but I don't actually know if it is still running or not.  If not, I won't bother finding it.
